sorular.soru: What should you take into account with strong crosswinds?
cevaplar: That you suddenly have to counter-steer.
That larger vehicles are particularly affected.
That the wind force can vary greatly.
That you are not allowed to overtake.
That crosswinds are usually less on flyovers.
dogruCevap: That you suddenly have to counter-steer.
That larger vehicles are particularly affected.
That the wind force can vary greatly.

feedback.metin: With crosswinds, you should take into account that you can suddenly veer off course. In that case, you suddenly have to counter-steer to stay on the lane. Overtaking is not prohibited with crosswinds. However, you do have to take into account the changing wind force when passing another vehicle. This also applies when passing other objects like trees and buildings. Larger vehicles are particularly affected by crosswinds, like lorries and vehicles with a trailer. So keep extra space near these vehicles. On viaducts and bridges, crosswinds are generally even stronger, as the wind is less obstructed here.

sorular.soru: Which drivers are you allowed to overtake after this sign?
cevaplar: Drivers of lorries.
Cyclists.
Moped riders.
Drivers of agricultural vehicles.
Motorcyclists.

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a prohibition for motorvehicles to overtake each other. It means you are not allowed to overtake any motor vehicles. Cyclists and moped riders do not fall under this category, and may be overtaken. Beware, brommobielen should be treated as motor vehicles, and are not allowed to be overtaken here.

sorular.soru: When should you stop the car as soon as possible?
cevaplar: As soon as your car suddenly loses power.
As soon as your braking pedal starts to vibrate while braking firmly.
As soon as a red light lights up at your dashboard.
As soon as a yellow light lights up at your dashboard.
As soon as your car starts making a weird noise.
dogruCevap: As soon as your car suddenly loses power.
As soon as a red light lights up at your dashboard.
As soon as your car starts making a weird noise.

feedback.metin: When there is something wrong with your car, it is best to stop and check it out. Stopping as soon as possible is always necessary if a red light lights up at your dashboard. Or when your car starts to make a weird noise or suddenly loses power. When a yellow light lights up at your dashboard but your car is still driving normally, you can drive on and check this light at a later time when parked safely. For instance at home or at a car park. When your brake pedal starts to vibrate while braking firmly, this means the ABS is intervening to prevent your wheels from locking. This is normal.

sorular.soru: Which road users should you give way to on a pedestrian crossing?
cevaplar: Horse handlers.
Drivers of a disabled vehicle.
Cyclists.
Pedestrians.
Skateboarders.

feedback.metin: At a pedestrian crossing, you should give way to pedestrians who are about to cross the street. This also includes people who transport themselves by use of an object such as a skateboard or inline-skates. Drivers of disabled vehicles who cross the street via a pedestrian crossing also fall under the category pedestrians and must be given way. Horse handlers and cyclists are not considered pedestrians and may not go first.

sorular.soru: Which drivers should you expect from the right here?
cevaplar: Cyclists.
Motorcyclists.
Moped riders.
Lorry drivers.

feedback.metin: Sign C-4 indicates that you are entering a one-way street. You must turn right here. The supplementary plate indicates that this one-way street does not apply to cyclists, snorfietsers, moped and speed-pedelec riders. Therefore, you should expect these drivers from the right. All other drivers are not allowed to enter this road from the opposite direction, so you should not expect motorcyclists or lorry drivers from the right.

sorular.soru: Your car has a maximum authorised mass of 1500 kg. Which trailers are you allowed to tow with your B licence only?
cevaplar: Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 750 kg.
Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 1000 kg.
Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 1500 kg.
Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 2000 kg.
dogruCevap: Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 750 kg.
Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 1000 kg.
Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 1500 kg.
Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of 2000 kg.

feedback.metin:
With a B licence, you may tow all trailers with a maximum authorised mass up to 750 kg. Heavier trailers are only allowed when the combined maximum authorised mass of the car and trailer is no more than 3500 kg. So if your car has a maximum authorised mass of 1500 kg, you can tow trailers with a maximum authorised mass up to 2000 kg. For heavier trailers, you need a BE licence.
However, always check the maximum weight that your car is technically allowed to tow.
